meanings.definition: To regard with intense aversion or loathing.
meanings.sent1: She abominated the taste of broccoli, refusing to eat it.
meanings.sent2: The villagers abominated the cruel dictator ruling over them.
meanings.sent3: The cat abominated the new brand of food, turning its nose up at it.
meanings.sent4: His abominated fear of spiders paralyzed him whenever he saw one.
meanings.sent5: The smell of rotten eggs abominated her senses, making her gag.

meanings.definition: To feel disgust or hatred towards.
meanings.sent1: He abominated the thought of having to work with his rival.
meanings.sent2: The child abominated the taste of medicine, making it hard for the parents to give it to him.
meanings.sent3: The student abominated the idea of having to take a pop quiz on a Friday afternoon.
meanings.sent4: The detective abominated the criminal for the heinous crimes committed.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the garbage dump abominated her, causing her to hold her breath as she passed by.
